page.title: 06SHATTRICK HOUSE BROADWAY
page.content: Shattrick house,situated in the village of Broadway is known for its fire place.It is the biggest Inglenook fire place in Great Britain.The fire place is 13 feet long and the depth is 15 feet. The house is about 400 or 500 years old,the fire place was built a little later than the house.The fire place has an oak beam which supports it and there are big slabs of cobb stone for the hearth. The fire place's chimney is very big,it was possible to see the sky if you stood under it,but it is now filled in.Shattrick house is not open to the public,but it is a very nice place.
